name: image
comment: The image library aims to provide server-side programs the ability to load, manipulate, and save various image file formats.

FLIP_BOTH.name: FLIP_BOTH
FLIP_BOTH.comment: Flip the image both horizontally and vertically.

PIXELATE_AVERAGE.name: PIXELATE_AVERAGE
PIXELATE_AVERAGE.comment: Use the average of the pixels within a block for the block color, used by image/image.pixelate.

PIXELATE_UPPERLEFT.name: PIXELATE_UPPERLEFT
PIXELATE_UPPERLEFT.comment: Use the top-left pixel of a block for the block color, used by image/image.pixelate.

TRIM_ALL.name: TRIM_ALL
TRIM_ALL.comment: Trim all edges of the image, used by image/image.findTrim and image/image.trim.

TRIM_BOTTOM.name: TRIM_BOTTOM
TRIM_BOTTOM.comment: Trim the image up from the bottom, used by image/image.findTrim and image/image.trim.

TRIM_BOTTOM_RIGHT_COLOR.name: TRIM_BOTTOM_RIGHT_COLOR
TRIM_BOTTOM_RIGHT_COLOR.comment: Trim an image to the top-left and bottom-right most pixels that are not the same as the bottom-right most pixel of the image, used by image/image.findTrim and image/image.trim.

TRIM_LEFT.name: TRIM_LEFT
TRIM_LEFT.comment: Trim the left edge of the image, used by image/image.findTrim and image/image.trim.

TRIM_RIGHT.name: TRIM_RIGHT
TRIM_RIGHT.comment: Trim the right edge of the image, used by image/image.findTrim and image/image.trim.

TRIM_TOP.name: TRIM_TOP
TRIM_TOP.comment: Trim the image down from the top, used by image/image.findTrim and image/image.trim.

TRIM_TOP_LEFT_COLOR.name: TRIM_TOP_LEFT_COLOR
TRIM_TOP_LEFT_COLOR.comment: Trim an image to the top-left and bottom-right most pixels that are not the same as the top-left most pixel of the image, used by image/image.findTrim and image/image.trim.

TRIM_TRANSPARENT.name: TRIM_TRANSPARENT
TRIM_TRANSPARENT.comment: Trim an image to the top-left and bottom-right most non-transparent pixels, used by image/image.findTrim and image/image.trim.

arial_14.name: arial_14
arial_14.comment: 14px Arial font for use with image/image.drawString and image/image.drawChar.

arial_24.name: arial_24
arial_24.comment: 24px Arial font for use with image/image.drawString and image/image.drawChar.

arial_48.name: arial_48
arial_48.comment: 48px Arial font for use with image/image.drawString and image/image.drawChar.

adjustColor.name: adjustColor
adjustColor.comment:
Adjust the color of the image/image.adjustColor.src image using varous color transformations.

image/image.adjustColor.blacks defines the black level of the image, as a color.

image/image.adjustColor.whites defines the white level of the image, as a color.

image/image.adjustColor.mids defines the mid level of hte image, as a color.

image/image.adjustColor.contrast increases (> 1) / decreases (< 1) the contrast of the image by pushing colors away/toward neutral gray, where at 0.0 the image is entirely neutral gray (0 contrast), 1.0, the image is not adjusted and > 1.0 the image increases contrast.

image/image.adjustColor.saturation increases (> 1) / decreases (< 1) the saturation of the image by pushing colors away/toward their grayscale value, where 0.0 is grayscale and 1.0 is the original image, and > 1.0 the image becomes more saturated.

image/image.adjustColor.brightness is a constant scalar of the image colors. At 0 the image is black, 1.0 unmodified, and > 1.0 the image becomes brighter.

image/image.adjustColor.gamma is an exponental scalar of the image colors. At < 1.0 the image becomes brighter, and > 1.0 the image becomes darker. A image/image.adjustColor.gamma of 1/2.2 will convert the image colors to linear color space.

image/image.adjustColor.exposure is an exponental scalar of the image as rgb * pow(2, exposure). At 0, the image is unmodified; as the exposure increases, the image brightens.

image/image.adjustColor.hue shifts the hue component of the image colors in degrees. A image/image.adjustColor.hue of 0 will have no affect, and a image/image.adjustColor.hue of 45 will shift the hue of all colors by 45 degrees.

image/image.adjustColor.amount controls how much affect this filter has on the image/image.adjustColor.src image, where 0.0 has no effect and 1.0 has full effect.

alphaBlendColors.name: alphaBlendColors
alphaBlendColors.comment: Returns a new color of image/image.alphaBlendColors.src alpha-blended onto image/image.alphaBlendColors.dst. The opacity of image/image.alphaBlendColors.src is additionally scaled by image/image.alphaBlendColors.fraction / 255.

brightness.name: brightness
brightness.comment:
Set the image/image.brightness.brightness level for the image image/image.brightness.src.

image/image.brightness.brightness is an offset that is added to the red, green, and blue channels of every pixel.

bumpToNormal.name: bumpToNormal
bumpToNormal.comment:
Generate a normal map from a heightfield bump image.

The red channel of the image/image.bumpToNormal.src image is used as an input, 0 represents a low height and 1 a high value. The optional image/image.bumpToNormal.strength parameter allows to set the strength of the normal image.

clipLine.name: clipLine
clipLine.comment: Clip a line to a rectangle using the Cohenâ€“Sutherland clipping algorithm. image/image.clipLine.line is a list of 4 ints <x1, y1, x2, y2>. image/image.clipLine.rect is a list of 4 ints <x1, y1, x2, y2>. Results are stored in image/image.clipLine.line. If image/image.clipLine.line falls completely outside of image/image.clipLine.rect, false is returned, otherwise true is returned.

colorOffset.name: colorOffset
colorOffset.comment: Add the image/image.colorOffset.red, image/image.colorOffset.green, image/image.colorOffset.blue and image/image.colorOffset.alpha values to the image/image.colorOffset.src image colors, a per-channel brightness.

contrast.name: contrast
contrast.comment:
Set the image/image.contrast.contrast level for the image image/image.contrast.src.

image/image.contrast.contrast values below 100 will decrees the contrast of the image, and values above 100 will increase the contrast. A contrast of of 100 will have no affect.

convolution.name: convolution
convolution.comment:
Apply a 3x3 convolution filter to the image/image.convolution.src image. image/image.convolution.filter should be a list of 9 doubles.

The rgb channels will be divided by image/image.convolution.filterDiv and add image/image.convolution.offset, allowing filters to normalize and offset the filtered pixel value.

copyInto.name: copyInto
copyInto.comment:
Copies a rectangular portion of one image to another image. image/image.copyInto.dst is the destination image, image/image.copyInto.src is the source image identifier.

In other words, copyInto will take an rectangular area from src of width src_w and height src_h at position (src_x,src_y) and place it in a rectangular area of image/image.copyInto.dst of width dst_w and height dst_h at position (dst_x,dst_y).

If the source and destination coordinates and width and heights differ, appropriate stretching or shrinking of the image fragment will be performed. The coordinates refer to the upper left corner. This function can be used to copy regions within the same image (if image/image.copyInto.dst is the same as image/image.copyInto.src) but if the regions overlap the results will be unpredictable.

copyResize.name: copyResize
copyResize.comment: Returns a resized copy of the image/image.copyResize.src image. If image/image.copyResize.height is -1, then it will be determined by the aspect ratio of image/image.copyResize.src and image/image.copyResize.width.

copyRotate.name: copyRotate
copyRotate.comment: Returns a copy of the image/image.copyRotate.src image, rotated by image/image.copyRotate.angle degrees.

decodeAnimation.name: decodeAnimation
decodeAnimation.comment: Decode the given image file bytes by first identifying the format of the file and using that decoder to decode the file into an image/image.Animation containing one or more image/image.Image frames.

decodeExr.name: decodeExr
decodeExr.comment: Decode an OpenEXR formatted image, tone-mapped using the given image/image.decodeExr.exposure to a low-dynamic-range image/image.Image.

decodeGif.name: decodeGif
decodeGif.comment: Decode a GIF formatted image (first frame for animations).

decodeGifAnimation.name: decodeGifAnimation
decodeGifAnimation.comment: Decode an animated GIF file. If the gif isn't animated, the animation will contain a single frame with the gif's image.

decodeImage.name: decodeImage
decodeImage.comment: Decode the given image file bytes by first identifying the format of the file and using that decoder to decode the file into a single frame image/image.Image.

decodeNamedAnimation.name: decodeNamedAnimation
decodeNamedAnimation.comment: Identify the format of the image using the file extension of the given image/image.decodeNamedAnimation.name, and decode the given file image/image.decodeNamedAnimation.bytes to an image/image.Animation with one or more image/image.Image frames. See also image/image.decodeAnimation.

decodeNamedImage.name: decodeNamedImage
decodeNamedImage.comment: Identify the format of the image using the file extension of the given image/image.decodeNamedImage.name, and decode the given file image/image.decodeNamedImage.bytes to a single frame image/image.Image. See also image/image.decodeImage.

decodeTiffAnimation.name: decodeTiffAnimation
decodeTiffAnimation.comment: Decode an multi-image (animated) TIFF file. If the tiff doesn't have multiple images, the animation will contain a single frame with the tiff's image.

decodeWebP.name: decodeWebP
decodeWebP.comment: Decode a WebP formatted image (first frame for animations).

decodeWebPAnimation.name: decodeWebPAnimation
decodeWebPAnimation.comment: Decode an animated WebP file. If the webp isn't animated, the animation will contain a single frame with the webp's image.

drawChar.name: drawChar
drawChar.comment: Draw a single character from image/image.drawChar.char horizontally into image/image.drawChar.image at position image/image.drawChar.x,image/image.drawChar.y with the given image/image.drawChar.color.

drawCircle.name: drawCircle
drawCircle.comment: Draw a circle into the image/image.drawCircle.image with a center of image/image.drawCircle.x0,image/image.drawCircle.y0 and the given image/image.drawCircle.radius and image/image.drawCircle.color.

drawLine.name: drawLine
drawLine.comment:
Draw a line into image/image.drawLine.image.

If image/image.drawLine.antialias is true then the line is drawn with smooth edges. image/image.drawLine.thickness determines how thick the line should be drawn, in pixels.

drawPixel.name: drawPixel
drawPixel.comment: Draw a single pixel into the image, applying alpha and opacity blending.

drawRect.name: drawRect
drawRect.comment: Draw a rectangle in the image image/image.drawRect.src with the image/image.drawRect.color.

drawString.name: drawString
drawString.comment:
Draw a string horizontally into image/image.drawString.image horizontally into image/image.drawString.image at position image/image.drawString.x,image/image.drawString.y with the given image/image.drawString.color.

You can load your own font, or use one of the existing ones such as: image/image.arial_14, image/image.arial_24, or image/image.arial_48.

dropShadow.name: dropShadow
dropShadow.comment: Create a drop-shadow effect for the image.

encodeGif.name: encodeGif
encodeGif.comment: Encode an image to the GIF format.

encodeGifAnimation.name: encodeGifAnimation
encodeGifAnimation.comment: Encode an animation to the GIF format.

encodeJpg.name: encodeJpg
encodeJpg.comment: Encode an image to the JPEG format.

encodeNamedImage.name: encodeNamedImage
encodeNamedImage.comment: Identify the format of the image and encode it with the appropriate image/image.Encoder.

encodePng.name: encodePng
encodePng.comment: Encode an image to the PNG format.

encodeTga.name: encodeTga
encodeTga.comment: Encode an image to the Targa format.

fill.name: fill
fill.comment: Set all of the pixels of an image/image.fill.image to the given image/image.fill.color.

fillRect.name: fillRect
fillRect.comment: Fill a rectangle in the image image/image.fillRect.src with the given image/image.fillRect.color with the corners image/image.fillRect.x1,image/image.fillRect.y1 and image/image.fillRect.x2,image/image.fillRect.y2.

findDecoderForData.name: findDecoderForData
findDecoderForData.comment: Find a image/image.Decoder that is able to decode the given image image/image.findDecoderForData.data. Use this is you don't know the type of image it is.

findTrim.name: findTrim
findTrim.comment: Find the crop area to be used by the trim function. Returns the coordinates as x, y, width, height. You could pass these coordinates to the image/image.copyCrop function to crop the image.

flip.name: flip
flip.comment: Flips the image/image.flip.src image using the given image/image.flip.mode, which can be one of: image/image.FLIP_HORIZONTAL, image/image.FLIP_VERTICAL, or image/image.FLIP_BOTH.

gaussianBlur.name: gaussianBlur
gaussianBlur.comment: Apply gaussian blur to the image/image.gaussianBlur.src image. image/image.gaussianBlur.radius determines how many pixels away from the current pixel should contribute to the blur, where 0 is no blur and the larger the radius, the stronger the blur.

getColor.name: getColor
getColor.comment: Get the color with the given image/image.getColor.r, image/image.getColor.g, image/image.getColor.b, and image/image.getColor.a components.

getDecoderForNamedImage.name: getDecoderForNamedImage
getDecoderForNamedImage.comment: Return the image/image.Decoder that can decode image with the given image/image.getDecoderForNamedImage.name, by looking at the file extension. See also image/image.findDecoderForData to determine the decoder to use given the bytes of the file.

getLuminanceRGB.name: getLuminanceRGB
getLuminanceRGB.comment: Returns the luminance (grayscale) value of the color.

grand.name: grand
grand.comment: Return a random variable following a gaussian distribution and a standard deviation of 1.

hdrBloom.name: hdrBloom
hdrBloom.comment: Applies an HDR bloom filter to the image, in-place.

hdrGamma.name: hdrGamma
hdrGamma.comment: Apply gamma scaling to the HDR image, in-place.

hdrToImage.name: hdrToImage
hdrToImage.comment: Convert a high dynamic range image to a low dynamic range image, with optional exposure control.

minMax.name: minMax
minMax.comment: Find the minimum and maximum color value in the image. Returns a list as <min, max>.

noise.name: noise
noise.comment: Add random noise to pixel values. image/image.noise.sigma determines how strong the effect should be. image/image.noise.type should be one of the following: image/image.NOISE_GAUSSIAN, image/image.NOISE_UNIFORM, [NOISE_SALT_PEPPER], image/image.NOISE_POISSON, or image/image.NOISE_RICE.

normalize.name: normalize
normalize.comment: Linearly normalize the colors of the image. All color values will be mapped to the range image/image.normalize.minValue, image/image.normalize.maxValue inclusive.

pixelate.name: pixelate
pixelate.comment:
Pixelate the image/image.pixelate.src image.

image/image.pixelate.blockSize determines the size of the pixelated blocks. If image/image.pixelate.mode is image/image.PIXELATE_UPPERLEFT then the upper-left corner of the block will be used for the block color. Otherwise if image/image.pixelate.mode is image/image.PIXELATE_AVERAGE, the average of all the pixels in the block will be used for the block color.

prand.name: prand
prand.comment: Return a random variable following a Poisson distribution of parameter image/image.prand.z.

quantize.name: quantize
quantize.comment: Quantize the number of colors in image to 256.

readFont.name: readFont
readFont.comment: Decode a image/image.BitmapFont from the contents of image/image.readFont.font definition (.fnt) file, and an image/image.Image that stores the font image/image.readFont.map.

readFontZip.name: readFontZip
readFontZip.comment: Decode a image/image.BitmapFont from the contents of a zip file that stores the .fnt font definition and associated PNG images.

reinhardToneMap.name: reinhardToneMap
reinhardToneMap.comment: Applies Reinhard tone mapping to the hdr image, in-place.

remapColors.name: remapColors
remapColors.comment: Remap the color channels of the image. image/image.remapColors.red, image/image.remapColors.green, image/image.remapColors.blue and image/image.remapColors.alpha should be set to one of the following: image/image.RED, image/image.GREEN, image/image.BLUE or image/image.ALPHA. For example, remapColors(src, red: GREEN, green: RED); will swap the red and green channels of the image.

seperableConvolution.name: seperableConvolution
seperableConvolution.comment:
Apply a generic seperable convolution filter the image/image.seperableConvolution.src image, using the given image/image.seperableConvolution.kernel.

image/image.gaussianBlur is an example of such a filter.

sepia.name: sepia
sepia.comment:
Apply sepia tone to the image.

image/image.sepia.amount controls the strength of the effect, in the range 0.0 - 1.0.

setAlpha.name: setAlpha
setAlpha.comment: Returns a new color where the alpha channel of image/image.setAlpha.color has been replaced by image/image.setAlpha.value.

setBlue.name: setBlue
setBlue.comment: Returns a new color where the blue channel of image/image.setBlue.color has been replaced by image/image.setBlue.value.

setChannel.name: setChannel
setChannel.comment: Returns a new color, where the given image/image.setChannel.color's image/image.setChannel.channel has been replaced with the given image/image.setChannel.value.

setGreen.name: setGreen
setGreen.comment: Returns a new color where the green channel of image/image.setGreen.color has been replaced by image/image.setGreen.value.

setRed.name: setRed
setRed.comment: Returns a new color where the red channel of image/image.setRed.color has been replaced by image/image.setRed.value.

smooth.name: smooth
smooth.comment:
Apply a smoothing convolution filter to the image/image.smooth.src image.

image/image.smooth.w is the weight of the current pixel being filtered. If it's greater than 1.0, it will make the image sharper.

sobel.name: sobel
sobel.comment: Apply Sobe edge detection filtering to the image/image.sobel.src Image.

trim.name: trim
trim.comment:
Automatically crops the image by finding the corners of the image that meet the image/image.trim.mode criteria (not transparent or a different color).

image/image.trim.mode can be either image/image.TRIM_TRANSPARENT, [TRIM_TOP_LEFT_CORNER] or [TRIM_BOTTOM_RIGHT_CORNER].

image/image.trim.sides can be used to control which sides of the image get trimmed, and can be any combination of image/image.TRIM_TOP, image/image.TRIM_BOTTOM, image/image.TRIM_LEFT, and image/image.TRIM_RIGHT.

class.name: Animation
class.preview: Stores multiple images, most oftenly as the frames of an animation.

class.name: BitmapFont
class.preview: A bitmap font that can be used with image/image.drawString and image/image.drawChar functions. You can generate a font files from a program like: http://kvazars.com/littera

class.name: BitmapFontCharacter
class.preview: A single character in a image/image.BitmapFont.

class.name: DecodeInfo
class.preview: Provides information about the image being decoded.

class.name: Decoder
class.preview: Base class for image format decoders.

class.name: Encoder
class.preview: Base class for image format encoders.

class.name: ExrDecoder
class.preview: Decode an OpenEXR formatted image.

class.name: ExrPizCompressor
class.preview: Wavelet compression

class.name: GifDecoder
class.preview: A decoder for the GIF image format. This supports both single frame and animated GIF files, and transparency.

class.name: Half
class.preview: A 16-bit floating-point number, used by high-dynamic-range image formats as a more efficient storage for floating-point values that don't require full 32-bit precision. A list of Half floats can be stored in a image/dart-typed_data.Uint16List, and converted to a double using the image/image.Half.HalfToDouble static method.

class.name: HdrImage
class.preview: A high dynamic range RGBA image stored in 16-bit or 32-bit floating-point channels.

class.name: HdrSlice
class.preview: A slice is the data for an image framebuffer for a single channel.

class.name: Image
class.preview: A 32-bit image buffer where pixels are encoded into 32-bit unsigned ints. You can use the methods in color to encode/decode the RGBA channels of a color for a pixel.

class.name: InputBuffer
class.preview: A buffer that can be read as a stream of bytes.

class.name: JpegDecoder
class.preview: Decode a jpeg encoded image.

class.name: JpegEncoder
class.preview: Encode an image to the JPEG format.

class.name: NeuralQuantizer
class.preview: Compute a 256 color map that best represents the given image.

class.name: PngDecoder
class.preview: Decode a PNG encoded image.

class.name: PngEncoder
class.preview: Encode an image to the PNG format.

class.name: PngFrame
class.preview: Decodes a frame from a PNG animation.

class.name: PsdDecoder
class.preview: Decode a Photoshop PSD image.

class.name: SeperableKernel
class.preview: A kernel object to use with image/image.seperableConvolution filtering.

class.name: TgaDecoder
class.preview: Decode a Targa TGA image. This only supports the 24-bit uncompressed format. TODO add more TGA support.

class.name: TgaEncoder
class.preview: Encode a Targa TGA image. This only supports the 24-bit uncompressed format.

class.name: VP8
class.preview: WebP lossy format.

class.name: VP8BandProbas
class.preview: All the probas associated to one band

class.name: VP8FInfo
class.preview: filter specs

class.name: VP8FilterHeader
class.preview: Filter parameters

class.name: VP8L
class.preview: WebP lossless format.

class.name: VP8MB
class.preview: Top/Left Contexts used for syntax-parsing

class.name: VP8MBData
class.preview: Data needed to reconstruct a macroblock

class.name: VP8Proba
class.preview: Struct collecting all frame-persistent probabilities.

class.name: VP8QuantMatrix
class.preview: Dequantization matrices

class.name: VP8SegmentHeader
class.preview: Segment features

class.name: VP8TopSamples
class.preview: Saved top samples, per macroblock. Fits into a cache-line.

class.name: WebPDecoder
class.preview: Decode a WebP formatted image. This supports lossless (vp8l), lossy (vp8), lossy+alpha, and animated WebP images.

class.name: WebPEncoder
class.preview: Encode an image to the PNG format.

class.name: WebPFrame
class.preview: Decodes a frame from a WebP animation.

class.name: WebPInfo
class.preview: Features gathered from the bitstream

ProgressCallback.name: ProgressCallback
ProgressCallback.comment: A callback called during the decoding process.
ProgressCallback.preview: A callback called during the decoding process.

error.name: ImageException
error.preview: An exception thrown when there was a problem in the image library.

packageIntro:
image

Overview

A Dart library providing the ability to load, save and manipulate images in a variety of different file formats.

The library has no reliance on dart:io, so it can be used for both server and web applications.

Supported Image Formats:

Read/Write:

  • PNG / Animated APNG
  • JPEG
  • Targa
  • GIF / Animated GIF

Read Only:

  • WebP / Animated WebP
  • TIFF
  • Photoshop PSD
  • OpenEXR

Documentation

API

Examples

Format Decoding Functions

Samples

Load an image, resize it, and save it as a png:

import 'dart:io' as Io;
import 'package:image/image.dart';
void main() {
  // Read an image from file (webp in this case).
  // decodeImage will identify the format of the image and use the appropriate
  // decoder.
  Image image = decodeImage(new Io.File('test.webp').readAsBytesSync());

  // Resize the image to a 120x? thumbnail (maintaining the aspect ratio).
  Image thumbnail = copyResize(image, 120);

  // Save the thumbnail as a PNG.
  new Io.File('thumbnail.png')
        ..writeAsBytesSync(encodePng(thumbnail));
}
